extensionDescription.message: Utilize the Firefox Sidebar to display the structural labels on a web page, including its page title, headings, and landmarks, for web accessibility evaluation.

helpHighlight.message: When you activate the selected heading in the list, the heading is highlighted on the page and scrolled into view.
helpHighlight.description: Help text describing how to highlight the selected heading on the page.

helpActivate.message: To activate the selected heading, use the 'Highlight Selected' button, or press 'enter' or 'return', or double-click the selection.
helpActivate.description: Help text describing how to activate the selected heading.

helpFocus.message: When a heading is highlighted on the page, using 'F6' to move focus to the page will cause the heading to receive focus.
helpFocus.description: Help text describing how to move focus to selected heading.

emptyContent.description: Message indicating that DOM element has no text content.

noHeadingElements.description: Message indicating that no heading elements were found in the document.

noLandmarkElements.description: Message indicating that no landmark elements were found in the document.

tabIsLoading.description: Message indicating that content in the sidebar panel is being updated.

protocolNotSupported.message: Protocol not supported; unable to retrieve content information.
protocolNotSupported.description: Message explaining that content script cannot be executed.
